name: Art Song
description: Vocal music with text often set to Poetry, typically for single vocalist with instrumental accompaniment, distinguished by its design for concert recital and high artistic demands requiring classically trained musicians.

children.name: Elizabethan Song
children.description: Monophonic style developed in Renaissance England that is typically composed in strophic form for one to several vocalists with instrumental accompaniment ranging from solo lute to chamber ensemble.

children.name: Lied
children.description: Form of song arising from 19th century German Romanticism, usually for solo vocalist & piano with a text derived from poetry.

children.name: MÃ©lodie
children.description: French form typically with a greater emphasis on emotional restraint, refinement, subtlety, and concision.

children.name: Orchestral Song
children.description: Classical song for solo voice or voices with orchestral accompaniment.
